sense.gloss: being used to, being comfortable with, being experienced in
to get used to, to grow accustomed to, to become familiar with
to become skilled in, to become experienced at
to become tame, to become domesticated
childhood friend, friend from infancy, old playmate
running-in, breaking in (e.g. engine, etc.), accustomizing, warming up
to become familiar with, to fit in, to adapt oneself, to get used to, to grow accustomed to
being used to ..., getting used to ..., being accustomed to, being conditioned to, be familiar with

sdata.j: その↑作家↑↓さっか↓の↑名↑↓な↓は↑僕↑↓ぼく↓らにはお↑馴染↑↓なじ↓みだ。
sdata.e: The author's name is familiar to us.

sdata.j: この↑辺↑↓あた↓りにはまるで↑馴染↑↓なじ↓みがない。
sdata.e: I'm quite a stranger around here.

sdata.j: この↑種↑↓たね↓の↑経験↑↓けいけん↓は↑誰↑↓だれ↓にも↑馴染↑↓なじ↓み↑深↑↓ふか↓い。
sdata.e: This kind of experience is familiar to everyone.

sdata.j: このライオンはよく↑飼↑↓か↓い↑馴↑↓な↓らされている。
あの↑人↑↓ひと↓はこの↑店↑↓みせ↓の↑長年↑↓ながねん↓の↑馴染↑↓なじ↓み↑客↑↓きゃく↓です。
sdata.e: He's been a patron of this store for many years.

sdata.j: スポロアウト↑先生↑↓せんせい↓が↑植物↑↓しょくぶつ↓を↑新↑↓あたら↓しい↑風土↑↓ふうど↓に↑馴染↑↓なじ↓ませた。
sdata.e: Professor Sprout acclimated the plant to a new environment.

sdata.j: ↑年上↑↓としうえ↓の↑人↑↓ひと↓にあまり↑馴↑↓な↓れ↑馴↑↓な↓れしくしてはいけない。
sdata.e: You must not take liberties with older people.

sdata.j: ↑彼↑↓かれ↓は↑早起↑↓はやお↓きには↑馴↑↓な↓れている。
sdata.e: He is used to getting up early.

sdata.j: ↑彼女↑↓かのじょ↓はニューイングランドの↑冬↑↓ふゆ↓には↑馴染↑↓なじ↓むことが↑出来↑↓でき↓なかった。
sdata.e: She couldn't accustom herself to New England winters.

sdata.j: ↑幼馴染↑↓おさななじみ↓ってこわ・・・。

words.gloss: to get used to, to grow accustomed to, to become familiar with
